text: Archery at the 1980 Summer Olympics was held at the archery field, located at the Krylatskoye Olympic Sports Centre (Krylatskoye district, Moscow). The archery schedule began on 30 July and ended on 2 August. Points were in a format called the double FITA round, which included 288 arrows shot over four days at four different distances: 70 meters, 60 meters, 50 meters, 30 meters for women; 90 meters, 70 meters, 50 meters, 30 meters for men. ==Medal summary== Competitors in the men's individual event. 1977 USSR commemorative stamp issued for the event ===Events=== {| |- |Men's | | | |- |Women's | | | |} ===Medal table=== ==Participating nations== {| class="wikitable collapsible sortable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" ! align=left | Nation !!
